comments:
RC2

1. On the CVS-Edit preference page enable 'Watch/Edit' and configure to 'Always
prompt'
2. Check out a plugin and open PDE editor on plugin.xml
3. On the dependencies page add a new dependency. Say 'No' when asked to perform
a validate edit.
4. Save

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Jun 15, 2004 10:30:42.167

PDE delegates the save to the abstract document provider.
So this either is a Platform/Text or a Platform/Team issue.

Moving arbitrarily to Platform/Text.

Wassim, the main problem here is that after the user vetoed you still make the
editor dirty which leads to an inconsistent state. You should not modify a
read-only file.

Test Case: verify this by editing plugin.xml in the PDE editor directly: the
editor stays read-only after clicking no to validateEdit.

Different manifestation of the validateEdit problem in bug 66597.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 66597 ***
